title: BenchmarkSummary
description:
The `BenchmarkSummary` containing all the information of a single benchmark run

This includes produced files, recorded callgrind events, performance regressions ...

benchmark_exe.description: The path to the binary which is executed by valgrind. In case of a library benchmark this is the compiled benchmark file. In case of a binary benchmark this is the path to the command.

benchmark_file.description: The path to the benchmark file

callgrind_summary.description: The summary of the callgrind run

details.description: More details describing this benchmark run

function_name.description: The name of the function under test

id.description: The user provided id of this benchmark

kind.description: Whether this summary describes a library or binary benchmark

module_path.description: The rust path in the form `bench_file::group::bench`

summary_output.description: The destination and kind of the summary file

tool_summaries.description: The summary of other valgrind tool runs

version.description: The version of this format. Only backwards incompatible changes cause an increase of the version

Baseline.description:
A `Baseline` depending on the [`BaselineKind`] which points to the corresponding path

This baseline is used for comparisons with the new output of valgrind tools.

path.description: The path to the file which is used to compare against the new output

oneOf.description: Compare new against `*.old` output files
Compare new against a named baseline

BenchmarkKind.description: The `BenchmarkKind`, differentiating between library and binary benchmarks

oneOf.description: A library benchmark
A binary benchmark

CallgrindRegression.description: The `CallgrindRegression` describing a single event based performance regression

diff_pct.description: The difference between new and old in percent. Serialized as string to preserve infinity values and avoid null in json.

event_kind.description: The [`EventKind`] which is affected by a performance regression

limit.description: The value of the limit which was exceeded to cause a performance regression. Serialized as string to preserve infinity values and avoid null in json.

new.description: The value of the new benchmark run

old.description: The value of the old benchmark run

CallgrindRun.description: The `CallgrindRun` contains all `CallgrindRunSegments` and their total costs in a `CallgrindTotal`.

total.description: The total costs of all `CallgrindRunSummary`s in this `CallgrindRunSummaries`

CallgrindRunSegment.description:
The `CallgrindRunSegment` containing the metric differences, performance regressions of a callgrind run segment.

A segment can be a part (caused by options like `--dump-every-bb=xxx`), a thread (caused by `--separate-threads`) or a pid (possibly caused by `--trace-children`). A segment is a summary over a single file which contains the costs of that part, thread and/or pid.

baseline.description: If present, the `Baseline` used to compare the new with the old output

command.description: The executed command extracted from Valgrind output

regressions.description: All detected performance regressions per callgrind run

CallgrindSummary.description: The `CallgrindSummary` contains the callgrind run, flamegraph paths and other paths to the segments of the callgrind run.

callgrind_run.description: The summary of all callgrind segments is a `CallgrindRun`

flamegraphs.description: The summaries of possibly created flamegraphs

CallgrindTotal.description: The total callgrind costs over the `CallgrindRunSegments` and all detected regressions for the total

regressions.description: All detected regressions for the total metrics

summary.description: The total over the segment metrics

Diffs.description: The differences between two `Metrics` as percentage and factor

diff_pct.description: The percentage of the difference between two `Metrics` serialized as string to preserve infinity values and avoid `null` in json

factor.description: The factor of the difference between two `Metrics` serialized as string to preserve infinity values and void `null` in json

EitherOrBoth_for_SegmentDetails.description:
Either left or right or both can be present

Most of the time, this enum is used to store (new, old) output, metrics, etc. Per convention left is always `new` and right is `old`.

This enum is inspired by `itertools::EitherOrBoth`. We use a simplification `EitherOrBoth<T>` instead of `EitherOrBoth<T,U = T>` because that is what we always need. Depending on `itertools` just because of this enum was no option. However, this simplified enum allows further optimizations, for example [`Self::map`] only needs a single closure instead of two.

# Developer notes

This enum is not considered complete in terms of possible functionality. Simply extend and add new methods by need.

oneOf.description: The left or `new` value
The right or `old` value
Both values (`new` and `old`) are present

EventKind.description:
All `EventKind`s callgrind produces and additionally some derived events

Depending on the options passed to Callgrind, these are the events that Callgrind can produce. See the [Callgrind documentation](https://valgrind.org/docs/manual/cl-manual.html#cl-manual.options) for details.

oneOf.description: The default event. I cache reads (which equals the number of instructions executed)
The number of system calls done (--collect-systime=yes)
The elapsed time spent in system calls (--collect-systime=yes)
The cpu time spent during system calls (--collect-systime=nsec)
The number of global bus events (--collect-bus=yes)
D Cache reads (which equals the number of memory reads) (--cache-sim=yes)
D Cache writes (which equals the number of memory writes) (--cache-sim=yes)
I1 cache read misses (--cache-sim=yes)
LL cache instruction read misses (--cache-sim=yes)
D1 cache read misses (--cache-sim=yes)
LL cache data read misses (--cache-sim=yes)
D1 cache write misses (--cache-sim=yes)
LL cache data write misses (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing the L1 hits (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing the LL hits (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing the RAM hits (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing the total amount of cache reads and writes (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing estimated CPU cycles (--cache-sim=yes)
Conditional branches executed (--branch-sim=yes)
Conditional branches mispredicted (--branch-sim=yes)
Indirect branches executed (--branch-sim=yes)
Indirect branches mispredicted (--branch-sim=yes)
Dirty miss because of instruction read (--simulate-wb=yes)
Dirty miss because of data read (--simulate-wb=yes)
Dirty miss because of data write (--simulate-wb=yes)
Counter showing bad temporal locality for L1 caches (--cachuse=yes)
Counter showing bad temporal locality for LL caches (--cachuse=yes)
Counter showing bad spatial locality for L1 caches (--cachuse=yes)
Counter showing bad spatial locality for LL caches (--cachuse=yes)

FlamegraphSummary.description:
The callgrind `FlamegraphSummary` records all created paths for an [`EventKind`] specific flamegraph

Either the `regular_path`, `old_path` or the `diff_path` are present. Never can all of them be absent.

base_path.description: If present, the path to the file of the old regular (non-differential) flamegraph

diff_path.description: If present, the path to the file of the differential flamegraph

regular_path.description: If present, the path to the file of the regular (non-differential) flamegraph

MetricsDiff.description:
The `MetricsDiff` describes the difference between a `new` and `old` metric as percentage and factor.

Only if both metrics are present there is also a `Diffs` present. Otherwise, it just stores the `new` or `old` metric.

diffs.description: If both metrics are present there is also a `Diffs` present

MetricsSummary_for_DhatMetricKind.description: The `MetricsSummary` contains all differences between two tool run segments

MetricsSummary_for_ErrorMetricKind.description: The `MetricsSummary` contains all differences between two tool run segments

MetricsSummary_for_EventKind.description: The `MetricsSummary` contains all differences between two tool run segments

SegmentDetails.description: Some additional and necessary information about the tool run segment

command.description: The executed command extracted from Valgrind output

details.description: More details for example from the logging output of the tool run

parent_pid.description: The parent pid of this process

part.description: The part of this tool run (only callgrind)

path.description: The path to the file from the tool run

thread.description: The thread of this tool run (only callgrind)

SummaryFormat.description: The format (json, ...) in which the summary file should be saved or printed

oneOf.description: The format in a space optimal json representation without newlines
The format in pretty printed json

SummaryOutput.description: Manage the summary output file with this `SummaryOutput`

path.description: The path to the destination file of this summary

ToolMetricSummary.description: The `ToolMetricSummary` contains the `MetricsSummary` distinguished by tool and metric kinds

oneOf.description: If there are no metrics extracted (currently massif, bbv)
The error summary of tools which reports errors (memcheck, helgrind, drd)
The dhat summary
The callgrind summary

ToolRun.description:
The `ToolRun` contains all information about a single tool run with possibly multiple segments

The total is always present and summarizes all tool run segments. In the special case of a single tool run segment, the total equals the metrics of this segment.

ToolRunSegment.description:
A single segment of a tool run and if present the comparison with the "old" segment

A tool run can produce multiple segments, for example for each process and subprocess with (--trace-children).

details.description: The details (like command, thread number etc.) about the segment(s)

ToolSummary.description: The `ToolSummary` containing all information about a valgrind tool run

log_paths.description: The paths to the `*.log` files. All tools produce at least one log file

out_paths.description: The paths to the `*.out` files. Not all tools produce an output in addition to the log files

summaries.description: The metrics and details about the tool run
